intro: Narcissus jeanmonodii, commonly known as the Jeanmonod daffodil, is a species of flowering plant in the Amaryllidaceae family. It is native to the Iberian Peninsula and is characterized by its striking, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to yellow. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and features narrow, grass-like leaves. It blooms in early spring, producing clusters of flowers that are highly ornamental. Due to its beauty and rarity, it is often cultivated in gardens and botanical collections.
